title: Strategies for Utilizing Interactive Technologies in Higher Education Mathematics Lectures

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Primarily master’s students with advanced expertise in mathematics, focusing on improving real-world problem-solving skills through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Cultivate the ability to explain mathematical concepts using Zoom’s whiteboard and real-time polling features in online synchronous environments.
Develop the ability to visually share mathematical problem-solving processes with peer learners using digital collaboration tools (e.g., Miro, Google Jamboard).
Apply a problem-solving protocol in the event of technical failures and propose strategies to build trust between instructors and students based on this approach
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
